thread.title: Video: Katy Perry Performs at Hillary Clinton Rally in Iowa
thread.title_full: Video: Katy Perry Performs at Hillary Clinton Rally in Iowa

author: AceShowbiz.com
title: Video: Katy Perry Performs at Hillary Clinton Rally in Iowa
text:
Comments The 'California Gurls' hitmaker is introduced by Bill Clinton before she delivers 'Firework' and 'Roar'. 
Katy Perry took the stage as a musical guest during Hillary Clinton's latest campaign stop in Iowa. The 31-year-old pop singer treated the crowd to her two inspiring singles "Firework" and "Roar" at the Iowa Events Center in Des Moines. Katy wore a white strapless dress complete with a Star-Spangled Banner cape. She was introduced by Bill Clinton. "I've never been the warm-up act for Katy Perry before, but I am well aware that I am the warm-up act," the former president said. "I stand and I march with Hillary. I believe in her future, her vision. I believe in her policies. I believe in equal rights for men, women, pay," the chart-topping singer explained why she supported the Democratic presidential candidate. Katy Perry also took over Hillary Clinton's Instagram. She posted a selfie with the female politician and showed her Hillary-inspired nails and a POTUS necklace she purchased as a birthday gift for her. Hillary is turning 68 on October 26, a day after Katy's own 31st birthday. A photo posted by Hillary Clinton (@hillaryclinton) on Oct 24, 2015 at 4:00pm PDT A photo posted by Hillary Clinton (@hillaryclinton) on Oct 24, 2015 at 1:02pm PDT A photo posted by Hillary Clinton (@hillaryclinton) on Oct 24, 2015 at 4:55pm PDT
